column5: Wednesday morning went 4 for 5 water was really low and clear which made fishing tough, the ones in the main holes weren't as active as they could see you but I landed one at first light, so I moved downstream and fished under a tree and hooked into 4 there and this big male was the last to come out of there.  I figure he weighed around 10 pounds he was really fat but the pic don't show it that well.  That is the tree I hooked him under in the top left and man what a bleep! it was to get him to come out from under there he musta went under there 6 or 7 times and each time I miraculously pulled him out.  Definately a fight to remember  http://i224.photobucket.com/albums/dd148/c...wk11/10lber.jpg  http://i224.photobucket.com/albums/dd148/c...0lbercloser.jpg  Hawk
Nice one. These low water conditions are Bull dont you think...
They do like the cover, good work CH...

Nice fall Steelhead !!!!!! and pics too.  ..yes the water is at record lows,im still really suprised that the fishing is as good as it is considering the low water levels everywhere....thanks for sharing...cheers
nice steel... need a little bit more rain, then im out!!!
like I said the ones underneath of logs and what not will bite if you can get your bait in front of them
that is a beast nice one
